pre_conditions: $gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0005'||$gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0007'||$gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0004'||$gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0006'

when: ($gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0005'&&$gt0009|BMI <25|<25,kg/m2)||$gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0007'
($gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0005'&&$gt0009|BMI <25|<25,kg/m2)||$gt0004|Type of diabetes type 2|.code=='at0007'

gt0006.description: Does patient have latent autoimmune diabetes of adults (LADA)?

gt0009.description: Is the patient's BMI less than 25 kg/m2?

gt0010.description: Select the patients renal function category based on eGFR (mL/min/1.73m2) and presence or absence of albuminuria.

gt0011.description: Is prescribing low cost medication a priority?

gt0012.description: Is promoting weight loss a priority?

gt1004.text: Suppress this recommendation for the next 6 months

gt2202.text:
Single drug therapy is recommended for newly diagnosed diabetes.

The listed medication is the guideline mandated first choice.

Consider multi-drug therapy only after 2-3 months of 'failed' monotherapy.

gt2208.text:
Dual therapy is recommended after 2-3 months of single drug therapy and persistently high HbA1c.

Triple therapy is recommended after 2-3 months of dual therapy and persistently high HbA1c.

Quad therapy may be considered after 2-3 months of 'failed' triple therapy.

See **Guidance** section below for medication alternatives.

gt2211.text:
**Single therapy:** Insulin is preferred 1st choice.

*An active prescription for Insulin medication was detected.*

gt2212.text:
* **Single therapy:** Metformin is preferred 1st choice.
* ***In case of severe hypoglycaemia with symptoms and / or acute conditions Insulin treatment is started primarily.** Switch to or supplement with Metformin when conditions have stabilized.*

*An active prescription for Metformin medication was detected.*

gt2213.text:
* **Single therapy:** Long-acting (basal) insulin is preferred 1st choice.
* **Double therapy:** Fast-acting insulin may be added.

gt2214.text:
* **Single therapy:** Rapid-acting (mealtime) insulin is preferred 1st choice.
* **Double therapy:** Metformin may be added.
* **Triple therapy:** Long-acting insulin may be added.

gt2215.text:
* **Single therapy:** Metformin is preferred 1st choice.
* ***In case of severe hypoglycaemia with symptoms and / or acute conditions Insulin treatment is started primarily.** Switch to or supplement with Metformin when conditions have stabilized.*

gt2219.text:
* DPP-4 inhibitor is an alternative to GLP-1 analogue.
* **Double therapy:** Insulin may be added.
* **WARNING:** DPP4 inhibitor must not be used together with GLP-1 analogue treatment.

gt2220.text:
* GLP-1 analogue is an alternative to DPP-4 inhibitor.
* **Double therapy:** Insulin may be added.
* **WARNING:** GLP-1 analogue must not be used together with DPP4-inhibitor treatment.
